author: Neal Baker
title: Dad admits stabbing pregnant wife to death in front of their two young children after months of violent abuse
text:
Comments A DAD-of-two stabbed to death his pregnant wife in front of their two children. 
Yevgeniu Savenok slayed wife Lyuba and their unborn son after months of abuse which had been reported to his parents and the police. Yevgeniu Savenok left his wife for dead after stabbing her eight times GOFUNDME Lyuba with their son and daughter, who were in the house when she was stabbed fACEBOOK 6 Yevgeniu admitted killing his wife after months of abuse 
He faces 65 years in prison after yesterday admitting the double murder at their home in Eden Prairie, Minnesota. 
Officers from the town’s police department travelled to Minneapolis to hear the verdict, with several saying it was the most horrific case they ever worked on. 
Savenok stabbed Lyuba eight times with a kitchen knife after storming into the family home on 14 May last year. 
He then fled with his two children, leaving her to die, Fox reported. 
Their unborn son died just minutes after an emergency c-section. 
Later on the day of the murder Savenok reported to a security guard at the United Hospital in St Paul and admitted killing her. 
He later hinted to investigators that he wanted to kill her because she was pregnant. In 2014 Lubya took out a protection order against her husband in Wheaton, Illinois where the family was then living. 
She told police of being beaten repeatedly, having her hair pulled and suffering cuts and bruises. 
In a police report she said: “With the increase of incidents and severity of [the attacks], I’ve gotten his parents and my parents involved, as well as our church.” fACEBOOK Lubya had told police and family about her husband’s violence fACEBOOK Lubya was pregnant with a boy when she was stabbed to death fACEBOOK 6 Lubya was killed in May last year 
A family statement read after Savenok’s guilty plea said: “It’s hard for us once again to hear the details of Lyuba’s senseless murder. 
“Her family, friends and loved ones feel deep sadness, loss and anger. 
“It has been especially difficult to learn that her son survived for a small time after the doctors tried to save him. Lyuba was going to name him Ellis.” 
An online fundraising campaign has received nearly $100,000 (£80,000) to go towards raising the two children Matthew, 4, and Vivienne, 3, who are staying with Lyuba’s brother Aleksandr Katane. Pregnant knifewoman in stab frenzy as girl gang attacks teens in Philadelphia
